Cannula API Docs¶

Here is some basic stuff.

Git Helper¶

class cannula.git.Git(directory)¶

Simple wrapper for git command line utils.

  • CANNULA_BASE/proxy/
  • CANNULA_BASE/supervisor/
  • CANNULA_BASE/config/(project)/

We store changes to the configs in git in order to allow rollbacks and to show history of changes, you know like in your code!

add_all()¶
commit(message)¶
diff()¶
head()¶
init()¶
modified_files()¶
new_files()¶
push(location, branch='master')¶
reset(revision='')¶
status()¶

Utility Functions¶

Cannula Utilities¶

Various helper scripts for the cannula framework.

cannula.utils.add_blank_choice(choices, force=False)¶

Prepend a blank choice to the passed choices list if it contains more than one choice. Always add a blank choice if force=True.

cannula.utils.call_subprocess(cmd, cwd=None, env=None)¶

Call subprocess and print out stderr/stdout during processing.

cannula.utils.import_object(dotted_path)¶

Import an object from a dotted path string.

If dotted_path contains no dots, then try to import and return a module.

cannula.utils.multi_process(cmds, cwd=None, env=None)¶

Run multiple processes in parallel and report status when finished. You might want to make sure these commands don’t hang otherwise I will never return ;)

This is usefull to run a command on multple remote hosts (git push remote ...)

cannula.utils.shell(command, cwd=None, env=None)¶

Simple shell command processing,

cannula.utils.shell_escape(text)¶

Escape the passed text for use in the shell (Bash). The output text will be enclosed in double quotes.

Built-in Workers¶

class cannula.worker.Worker(name, project, **kwargs)¶

Worker Class

Created when a task is being run based off of the projects settings. These can be overwritten by the deployment.

write_startup_script()¶

Write out startup script for worker type.

class cannula.worker.gunicorn_django(name, project, **kwargs)¶

Gunicorn Django worker.

Built-in Runtimes available¶

class cannula.runtime.Python¶

Python runtime setup and teardown.

classmethod bootstrap(project, application)¶

Initialize a virtual environment for this project.

Looks for a ‘requirements.txt’ file for packages to install.

Available Proxies¶

Proxy handlers¶

These define the how the proxy are setup. The simplest proxies should only need to define the ‘name’ and optionally the ‘template_base’ attributes. All the magic is handled by the templates. The templates are arranged like this:

proxy/
    nginx/
        main.conf
        vhost.conf
        ...
    apache/
        main.conf
        vhost.conf
        ...
class cannula.apis.v2.proxy.Apache(template_base='proxy')¶
extra_files = []¶
main_conf_name = 'httpd.conf'¶
name = 'apache'¶
restart_cmd = '%(cmd)s -f %(main_conf)s -k graceful'¶
start_cmd = '%(cmd)s -f %(main_conf)s -k start'¶
stop_cmd = '%(cmd)s -f %(main_conf)s -k stop'¶
class cannula.apis.v2.proxy.Nginx(template_base='proxy')¶
extra_files = ['mime.types', 'fastcgi_params', 'scgi_params', 'uwsgi_params', 'win-utf']¶
main_conf_name = 'nginx.conf'¶
name = 'nginx'¶
restart_cmd = '%(cmd)s -c %(main_conf)s -s reload'¶
start_cmd = '%(cmd)s -c %(main_conf)s'¶
stop_cmd = '%(cmd)s -c %(main_conf)s -s stop'¶
class cannula.apis.v2.proxy.Proxy(template_base='proxy')¶
conf_type = 'proxy'¶
extra_files = []¶
manual_start_cmd¶
name = ''¶
restart()¶

Restart the proxy service.

restart_cmd = 'echo "Proxy did not define restart_cmd"'¶
start()¶

Start the proxy service.

start_cmd = 'echo "Proxy did not define start_cmd"'¶
stop()¶

Stop the proxy service.

stop_cmd = 'echo "Proxy did not define stop_cmd"'¶
write_vhost_conf(project, extra_context={})¶
